content: Just installed TBird on new laptop, had an awful time. On the main mail page, across the top, there is a search bar (ctrl k). Should there be a 2nd one below it in the middle? title: Is there an Add-on to will let me Add a Tab to Account List
content:
A number of times when I'm answering email and need to check back on the list of emails, I don't see a Tab to take me directly to my list of email accounts (I have 8). A couple of times I've had to shut down T-bird and re-launch it to get back to this list/window. I don't understand why such a Tab isn't available everywhere.

So I'm looking for an add-on which would allow me to add a specific Tab on the T-bird pages where it isn't there, specifically, a Tab to get to the window which has the list of my email accounts.

If there is such a customization, I'd appreciate getting a link to get it.
creator: KJS-LES

title: Inbox sub-folders disappeared after update to 140 - Ymail account only effected.
content:
Hi,

I updated to 140 on one windows laptop, since then the Inbox sub-folders of a Ymail account disappear. The weird thing was that on start-up, some were displayed, but disappear one-by-one. Another laptop which was running 120 still had the sub-folders intact. I updated that to 140, and when TB restarted, the sub-folders were displayed, then slowly disappeared, one-by-one. It is only the Ymail account that is effected, we have a couple of Outlook accounts that display their Inbox sub-folders. I have selected "Subscribe", all folders are selected. I've unticked the sub-folders thinking that maybe it would allow me to re-select them, but on a re-start they are still shown as selected.

Hope you have a solution.

Thanks,

b0b
creator: drdos7666

title: Thunderbird toolbars
content: I am running Thunderbird 140.0 on Windows 11. I want to have some buttons for extensions that are not in my toolbar appear in my toolbar. The advice for Firefox is to use the Extensions button in the toolbar, but I do not have that button in my toolbar and have not been able to find out how to get one into my toolbar.
creator: rogerandjennifer

title: Toolbar trivia
content: I'm running Thunderbird 140.0 on Windows 11. I love the things that extensions can do and so have a lot of them (I do worry about conflicts, but that seems to be less of a problem now). One problem I see is that the space allotted for the toolbar is too limited. It would be helpful if I could reduce slightly the space between the buttons. I like the icon above description arrangement, but there are a couple with very long descriptions that are shown all on one line, making the button take up a lot of space. Another thing that I've wondered about is the possibility of having another toolbar to contain the buttons that won't fit into the standard space.
creator: rogerandjennifer

title: Feature Request: "Greyscale Unregistered Senders" Option
content:
Dear Thunderbird Team,

I'm an active user of Thunderbird for my daily email management and greatly appreciate the flexibility your program offers. The ability to color-code emails from contacts in my address book has been incredibly helpful in organizing my inbox.

However, distinguishing and color-coding emails from senders not in my address book is quite cumbersome with the current filtering system. Manually creating "does not contain" rules for each individual address is impractical and requires constant updates.

At this point, I'd like to submit a feature request that would significantly enhance the user experience:

A one-click button or easily accessible setting, such as "Greyscale Unregistered Senders."

Having this feature directly integrated into the Thunderbird interface (for instance, within Inbox settings or under the Tools menu) would save a significant amount of time and offer great visual convenience, especially for users who receive a large volume of emails. Having emails from unregistered senders appear in greyscale or a similar neutral color would help in quickly identifying important emails while separating those from unknown senders.

I believe that integrating such a feature would further strengthen Thunderbird's user-friendly design and make email management even more intuitive.

Thank you for considering my request. I wish you continued success in your work.

Sincerely,

Selçuk Göktekin
creator: selcukgokteki
